meanings.definition: A silvery-white metallic chemical element with the symbol Ce and atomic number 58.
meanings.sent1: Cerium is often used in the production of certain types of glass.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study cerium to understand its properties better.
meanings.sent3: The cerium in the lab seemed to have a mischievous glint in its eye.
meanings.sent4: The cerium of the periodic table stood out like a shining star.
meanings.sent5: When exposed to air, cerium can develop a thin layer of oxide on its surface.

meanings.definition: A compound containing cerium, used in various industrial applications.
meanings.sent1: The factory workers mixed cerium into the solution for the new coating.
meanings.sent2: Cerium compounds are essential in the manufacturing of catalysts.
meanings.sent3: The cerium compound seemed to dance under the microscope's lens.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a cerium compound, catalyzing change in the organization.
meanings.sent5: The cerium compound added a unique sparkle to the final product.
